outline: Rob was upset about some things the city council was doing.
Lisa had a house cat Ruffles.

One day Ruffles wanted to go outside.
Rob also spoke at several city council meetings.
Ruffles walked out.
Thankfully, Rob was able to prevent the measure from being implemented.
Luckily Lisa caught Ruffles in time.
response:
Rob had lived on the same street for years, and he loved everything about it. However, he wasn't too pleased when he heard that the city council was planning to implement permit parking on his street. He knew that this would cause a lot of inconvenience for the residents, and he was determined to do something about it.

Rob decided to organize a petition to protest against the measure. He went door to door, explaining to his neighbors why permit parking was a bad idea. He collected numerous signatures, and he felt confident that he could make a difference.

Rob also spoke at several city council meetings, expressing his concerns about the permit parking measure. He argued that it would only cause more problems, and it would not solve the parking issues in the area.

Meanwhile, Lisa had a house cat named Ruffles. Ruffles was a lively cat who loved to play and explore. However, Lisa always made sure that Ruffles stayed inside, as she was afraid that he would get lost or hurt.

One day, Ruffles wanted to go outside. He meowed and scratched at the door, begging Lisa to let him out. Lisa was hesitant, but she eventually gave in to Ruffles' pleas.

As soon as Ruffles stepped outside, he ran towards Rob's house. Rob saw Ruffles coming towards him, and he quickly realized that he had to prevent him from getting out onto the street.

Thankfully, Rob was able to catch Ruffles before he got out onto the street. He picked him up and carried him back to Lisa's house.

A few days later, the city council held another meeting to discuss the permit parking measure. Rob was there, along with many other concerned residents. He spoke passionately about the negative impact that permit parking would have on the community, and he urged the council to reconsider their decision.

In the end, the city council decided not to implement the permit parking measure. Rob was overjoyed, knowing that he had made a difference. Lisa was also relieved, knowing that Ruffles was safe and sound inside her home.
eval_result:
60

The subplot of Lisa's cat Ruffles wanting to go outside and being caught by Rob is somewhat integrated into the main narrative. It provides an opportunity for interaction between Rob and Lisa, and it adds a bit of drama and tension to the story. However, it doesn't significantly contribute to the main plot of Rob's fight against the permit parking measure. The subplot could be removed without drastically affecting the main storyline.

Sam had always been a picky eater. He couldn't stand the sight or smell of certain foods, and peanut butter and banana sandwiches were one of those. So when he walked into the kitchen and saw his brother Barry munching on one, he made a face.

"That's the grossest thing I've ever seen," he said.

Barry, undeterred, offered Sam a bite. "Try it, man. It's really good."

Sam shook his head. "No way. I'd rather eat dirt."

But Barry persisted, and after several weeks of gentle (and not-so-gentle) persuasion, Sam finally relented. He took a bite of the sandwich, and to his surprise, it wasn't half bad. In fact, it was pretty tasty.

Meanwhile, their sister Holly had always been focused on her studies. She had her sights set on a Master's in Public Health, and she worked hard to maintain a good grade point average. She also interned with the local Health Department, gaining valuable experience in the field.

During her senior year, Holly was able to apply to graduate schools, and all her hard work paid off. She was accepted into the program of her dreams and couldn't have been happier.

And as for Sam? Well, he now eats peanut butter and banana sandwiches at least once a week. Who knew that something that had once seemed so gross could actually be pretty delicious?

One day, Cindy's best friend at work managed to convince her to tag along for drinks after work. Cindy was hesitant, but she agreed. She wore her best outfit and headed out with the group.

Meanwhile, Nellie had decided to go to the beach for some much-needed rest and relaxation. She laid on the sand, listening to the sound of the waves and watching the seagulls hovering overhead. It was so peaceful that Nellie dozed off.

A few hours later, Nellie woke up in a panic. She was covered from head to toe in heavy, wet sand. She had no idea what had happened and how she had ended up in this state. She tried to brush off the sand, but it clung to her skin and clothes stubbornly.

Back at the happy hour, Cindy was enjoying herself. She realized that she had been missing out on a lot of fun with her coworkers. They were all drinking beer and laughing over silly jokes. Cindy was pleased that she had finally joined them.

Suddenly, her phone rang, and it was Nellie. She sounded frantic, and Cindy could barely make out what she was saying. Nellie had woken up to find herself buried in sand, and she had no idea how it had happened.

Cindy and her coworkers rushed to the beach to find Nellie. When they got there, they were shocked to see Nellie covered in sand, looking like a mummy. It turned out that Nellie's little brother had come to the beach and buried her as a prank while she was sleeping.

Everyone had a good laugh at Nellie's expense, and Cindy realized that she had been wrong to think that happy hour with her coworkers was unprofessional. She had finally let her guard down and had a great time. As for Nellie, she was relieved to be rescued and grateful to have such great friends.
